guild.description:
A free-speech haven to post dank christian memes away from crazy mods and Reddit drama.

ALL Christian memes are welcome! 

Rules:

1) **Memes must be about Christianity:** Off-topic posts will be kicked

2) **Don't be a Moron:** May result in a 3 minute temp-ban and the red hammer of *shame*, plus we will make fun of you.
   
3) **No Heresy/Blasphemy:** This is the only thing you can get perma-banned.


Related guilds: +veggietales_memes

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body:
No, I'm sincerely wondering why you view being unmarried as a problem, an attitude which I inferred from your previous comments because you said you see everything that distracts from the goal of marriage as a vanity. And while you did say that for some people living without a husband or wife is for them, you have already decided that it is not in the best interests of your children:

> I said that insofar as the average person will get married, and that it is only for some to be without a husband or a wife. The main point being that i would discourage her from pursuing a "career," because her capacity to pursue one does not mean it is in her best interest.

body: Except that hell isn't even in the original bible except for *one* reference to a place of torment with fire, in a parable likely derived from other popular stories of the day. There's also symbolic references in Revelation, whose authenticity is questionable and the earliest Christians did not interpret it to mean a place where spirits burn and boil in a pit of lava for eternity.
body_html: Except that hell isn't even in the original bible except for one reference to a place of torment with fire, in a parable likely derived from other popular stories of the day. There's also symbolic references in Revelation, whose authenticity is questionable and the earliest Christians did not interpret it to mean a place where spirits burn and boil in a pit of lava for eternity.

parent.body:
Sharing is also voluntary in a communist state. Just that you would be thrown into gulag if you don't, or, in the case of Christianity, would be thrown into hell if Jesus detects that you are a thought criminal.

The ethereal and non-material, and hence impossible to prove nature of the Christian gulag does not detract from its status as a gulag.

body:
Who told you the bible was God's word? Be careful and check your sources on that. The bible was compiled in 382 AD by the catholic church, Paul did not write 2 Timothy and "scriptures" at the time it was written referred only to the old testament, not Hebrews. You should be aware, however, that God *did* warn this, and you can find it in the bible itself at Jeremiah 8:8:

"How can you say, 'we are wise, and 𐤉𐤄𐤅𐤄's law (Torah) is with us' when in reality the deceitful pen of scribes has lied?!"

And the bible absolutely does contradict itself, you have to make mindboggling reinterpretations to try and glue it all together.
body_html:
Who told you the bible was God's word? Be careful and check your sources on that. The bible was compiled in 382 AD by the catholic church, Paul did not write 2 Timothy and "scriptures" at the time it was written referred only to the old testament, not Hebrews. You should be aware, however, that God did warn this, and you can find it in the bible itself at Jeremiah 8:8:

"How can you say, 'we are wise, and 𐤉𐤄𐤅𐤄's law (Torah) is with us' when in reality the deceitful pen of scribes has lied?!"

And the bible absolutely does contradict itself, you have to make mindboggling reinterpretations to try and glue it all together.

> "anonymous writer of Hebrews" 

> Hebrews is literally in the Bible, God's word

> 2 Tim 3:16: "All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness"

The Bible doesn't contradict itself because it is the word of God.

"anonymous writer of Hebrews"

Hebrews is literally in the Bible, God's word

2 Tim 3:16: "All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness"

The Bible doesn't contradict itself because it is the word of God.

body:
Well let's see:

1 Corinthians 14

> ...Two or three prophets should speak, and the others should weigh carefully what is said. And if a revelation comes to someone who is sitting down, the first speaker should stop. For you can all prophesy in turn so that everyone may be instructed and encouraged. The spirits of prophets are subject to the control of prophets. For God is not a God of disorder but of peace—as in all the congregations of the Lord’s people.
> 
> Women should remain silent in the churches. They are not allowed to speak, but must be in submission, as the law says. If they want to inquire about something, they should ask their own husbands at home; for it is disgraceful for a woman to speak in the church.
> 
> Or did the word of God originate with you? Or are you the only people it has reached? If anyone thinks they are a prophet or otherwise gifted by the Spirit, let them acknowledge that what I am writing to you is the Lord’s command. But if anyone ignores this, they will themselves be ignored...

Now why the hell would Paul be talking about orderly prophesying in church, then suddenly say "Oh by the way women aren't people" and then continue on his argument about orderly prophesying as if he never stopped? That makes NO sense for a person writing a letter to a church, but it *does* make sense that a later church father who associated women with Marcionism could've added it, as was a common practice in ancient times. Plus, the "law" he is referring to is no biblical law as Paul usually uses it. It is the law of the Roman Empire, and the writer here gives no indication that he is using "law" differently, as we would expect of the same author.

1 Corinthians 11


> I praise you for remembering me in everything and for holding to the traditions just as I passed them on to you.
> 
> But I want you to realize that the head of every man is Christ, and the head of the woman is man, and the head of Christ is God. Every man who prays or prophesies with his head covered dishonors his head. But every woman who prays or prophesies with her head uncovered dishonors her head—it is the same as having her head shaved. For if a woman does not cover her head, she might as well have her hair cut off; but if it is a disgrace for a woman to have her hair cut off or her head shaved, then she should cover her head. A man ought not to cover his head, since he is the image and glory of God; but woman is the glory of man. For man did not come from woman, but woman from man; neither was man created for woman, but woman for man. It is for this reason that a woman ought to have authority over her own head, because of the angels. Nevertheless, in the Lord woman is not independent of man, nor is man independent of woman. For as woman came from man, so also man is born of woman. But everything comes from God. Judge for yourselves: Is it proper for a woman to pray to God with her head uncovered? Does not the very nature of things teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a disgrace to him, but that if a woman has long hair, it is her glory? For long hair is given to her as a covering. If anyone wants to be contentious about this, we have no other practice—nor do the churches of God.
> 
> But in the following directives I have no praise for you, for your meetings do more harm than good. In the first place, I hear that when you come together as a church, there are divisions among you, and to some extent I believe it...

Yet again we have an abrupt ending of the topic at hand, a passage about women being lesser creatures, and then a sudden continuation of the previous matter as if the topic had never changed in the first place. Again, does it make any sense for me to put something completely unrelated in my argument here? No, but it does make sense if someone is trying to add it to the text. The original read much more clearly "I praise you for remembering me in everything and for holding to the traditions just as I passed them on to you. But in the following directives I have no praise for you, for your meetings do more harm than good...". There is another problem with this passage: it condemns long hair on men and short hair on women. However if you remember you could take a special Nazarite vow which included not cutting your hair. This is what Sampson was. Paul himself, according to some sources, was a Nazarite. Jesus was also likely one. So this does not make any sense as being from Paul.

1 Timothy, 2 Timothy, Titus, 1 Peter, 2 Peter, Jude, James, 1 John, 2 John, 3 John: These are almost certainly not written by who they say they are. Maybe Revelation, Ephesians, Colossians, and 2 Thessalonians too. In ancient times it was a common practice for someone who considered themselves a follower of someone to, after the real person had died, continue their work for them, which included writing under their name. Forgery too, was also common.

It also appears that most of the old testament laws were forgeries. The oldest Biblical characters had no awareness of almost any of them, even the super important ones. For example, being born a Moabite was condemned, non-Levites were to be stoned to death for approaching priestly areas, eunuchs were abominations, and even having a physical impairment, such as blindness, or being a woman, defiled you. Yet David was half Moabite, and so were his priests. The prophets praise eunuchs. People who suffer impairments are thought to be rewarded, not condemned. Deborah was a judge and there were plenty of prophetesses. God told Jeremiah that he never gave any instructions for animal sacrifice or burning people, but that the lying pen of scribes had made it so as they did more evil than their ancestors in Egypt. And this was just after a very sketchy incident where Josiah "found" a book of law that had somehow only had a single copy and been misplaced in the temple; just in time for him to implement his desired reforms and give himself more power. This lines up almost perfectly with scholarship, which has found multiple sources for the old testament books and agrees with Jeremiah that the laws were from later sources.
body_html:
Well let's see:

1 Corinthians 14

...Two or three prophets should speak, and the others should weigh carefully what is said. And if a revelation comes to someone who is sitting down, the first speaker should stop. For you can all prophesy in turn so that everyone may be instructed and encouraged. The spirits of prophets are subject to the control of prophets. For God is not a God of disorder but of peace—as in all the congregations of the Lord’s people.

Women should remain silent in the churches. They are not allowed to speak, but must be in submission, as the law says. If they want to inquire about something, they should ask their own husbands at home; for it is disgraceful for a woman to speak in the church.

Or did the word of God originate with you? Or are you the only people it has reached? If anyone thinks they are a prophet or otherwise gifted by the Spirit, let them acknowledge that what I am writing to you is the Lord’s command. But if anyone ignores this, they will themselves be ignored...

Now why the hell would Paul be talking about orderly prophesying in church, then suddenly say "Oh by the way women aren't people" and then continue on his argument about orderly prophesying as if he never stopped? That makes NO sense for a person writing a letter to a church, but it does make sense that a later church father who associated women with Marcionism could've added it, as was a common practice in ancient times. I praise you for remembering me in everything and for holding to the traditions just as I passed them on to you.

But I want you to realize that the head of every man is Christ, and the head of the woman is man, and the head of Christ is God. parent.body:
>No shit his letters weren't written by Jewish scholars.

They weren't written by any Jew period. And you're literally the one calling it God's word. Also, according to Acts Paul was a prominent student of Gamaliel. 

>What do you think Paul got wrong in his letters?

Every single thing. It's a trainwreck. He didn't know seed in Hebrew, zera, is the same in singular and plural (Gal. 3:16), not did he understand simple context. What kind of a Jew and student of Gamaliel don't know basic Hebrew? He taught Lo-Ammi was a prophecy about gentiles. He called the ones following the sign of God's covenant dogs and mutilaters of the flesh. What kind of Jew talks like that about the sign of God's covenant? He called the law a curse, and completely flipped and perverted ever simple clear-cut Torah scripture. He falsely juxtaposed faith and law. His writings only doesn't contain a single word suggesting he was even remotely familiar with Pharisaical doctrine. The Pauline epistles was written by a man that didn't know anything about the Hebrew Bible period.
parent.body_html:
No shit his letters weren't written by Jewish scholars.

They weren't written by any Jew period. And you're literally the one calling it God's word. Also, according to Acts Paul was a prominent student of Gamaliel.

What do you think Paul got wrong in his letters?

Every single thing. It's a trainwreck. He didn't know seed in Hebrew, zera, is the same in singular and plural (Gal. 3:16), not did he understand simple context. What kind of a Jew and student of Gamaliel don't know basic Hebrew? He taught Lo-Ammi was a prophecy about gentiles. He called the ones following the sign of God's covenant dogs and mutilaters of the flesh. What kind of Jew talks like that about the sign of God's covenant? He called the law a curse, and completely flipped and perverted ever simple clear-cut Torah scripture. He falsely juxtaposed faith and law. His writings only doesn't contain a single word suggesting he was even remotely familiar with Pharisaical doctrine. The Pauline epistles was written by a man that didn't know anything about the Hebrew Bible period.

The globalists want to rebuild on a weak foundation of sand: critical theory, racial conflict, crony capitalism, political corruption, godless nihilist consumerism, etc. We need to build back on the foundation of Christ, family values, life, and fellowship. That’s how we will build back much better than ever before as we watch their foundation of sand collapse on itself.

body: The masoretic is still more accurate outside of those few corruptions. And the Greek text has corruptions of its own. It's not that significant though, the worst was in the time of Josiah and then again during/after the Babylonian exile in the 4th century BC.

post.title: Andrew Torba: In order to build something “back better” it must be built on a better foundation than before. The globalists want to rebuild on a weak foundation of sand: critical theory, racial conflict, crony capitalism, political corruption, godless nihilist consumerism, etc. We need to build back on the foundation of Christ, family values, life, and fellowship. That’s how we will build back much better than ever before as we watch their foundation of sand collapse on itself.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

post.body:
Different parts of the US are requiring temperature checks just to enter the grocery store, this will one day evolve into scanning your skin for the 666 qr code. Don't have it? Sorry, you can't enter the grocery store. 

When the antichrist comes, Christians will know he is the antichrist and the liberal machine will call us conspiracy theorists, tin foil hat wearers. 

The beast system is here, it is in its infancy stage.

body:
> Oh, so the Torah Israel was required to keep as affirmed by every prophet was corrupted(but not the prophetic writings themselves conveniently)? Good luck with that theory.

Yes, and any references they have to it is from later redactions, and no the prophetic writings are also corrupt, they're completely out of order half the time. Before the time of Josiah none of the people in the bible were aware of hardly any of the laws and that is evident by their actions. For example David was a Moabite and so were his priests...something that according to the Torah is offense deserving of being *stoned to death*. The Torah also has commandments to make animal sacrifices to please God with the "savory aroma". What pagan nonsense! And then we see God *complaining* about sacrifices being made in multiple of the prophets. Read the whole of Jeremiah chapters 7-8, there are attacks on several of the laws followed by the comment about the corrupt scribes. It's difficult to reinterpret this as being about external works. Interpolation was a common practice in the ancient world, and God specifically says they don't have his law, and the reason they don't have his law is because the scribes had not been honest with it. Combined with several commands to *not* do things which are commanded in the Torah, it's hard to bend this any other way.

> And Imagine thinking Paul was the one that got it right in his trainwreck that doesn't even line up with Jesus and the gospels.

When you get rid of the fake letters and interpolations from the church fathers it lines up very closely. But I believe you're mistaken, I don't listen to Paul before Jesus.
body_html:
Oh, so the Torah Israel was required to keep as affirmed by every prophet was corrupted(but not the prophetic writings themselves conveniently)? Good luck with that theory.

Yes, and any references they have to it is from later redactions, and no the prophetic writings are also corrupt, they're completely out of order half the time. Before the time of Josiah none of the people in the bible were aware of hardly any of the laws and that is evident by their actions. For example David was a Moabite and so were his priests...something that according to the Torah is offense deserving of being stoned to death. The Torah also has commandments to make animal sacrifices to please God with the "savory aroma". What pagan nonsense! And then we see God complaining about sacrifices being made in multiple of the prophets. Read the whole of Jeremiah chapters 7-8, there are attacks on several of the laws followed by the comment about the corrupt scribes. It's difficult to reinterpret this as being about external works. Interpolation was a common practice in the ancient world, and God specifically says they don't have his law, and the reason they don't have his law is because the scribes had not been honest with it. Combined with several commands to not do things which are commanded in the Torah, it's hard to bend this any other way.

And Imagine thinking Paul was the one that got it right in his trainwreck that doesn't even line up with Jesus and the gospels.

When you get rid of the fake letters and interpolations from the church fathers it lines up very closely. But I believe you're mistaken, I don't listen to Paul before Jesus.

parent.body:
What a weird coincidence it will be when the Israeli authorities announce that these Dead Sea Scrolls contain oddly specific passages from Jesus himself concerning who are the rightful heirs of Israel.

Weirder still that Jesus was so specific about the King James Version of the Bible being heresy. Good thing I have my Scofield Bible!
parent.body_html:
What a weird coincidence it will be when the Israeli authorities announce that these Dead Sea Scrolls contain oddly specific passages from Jesus himself concerning who are the rightful heirs of Israel.

post.meta_description: Israeli archaeologists on Tuesday announced the discovery of dozens of Dead Sea Scroll fragments bearing a biblical text found in a desert cave and believed hidden during a Jewish revolt against Rome nearly 1,900 years ago.
post.meta_title: Israeli experts announce discovery of more Dead Sea scrolls
post.title: Israeli experts announce discovery of more Dead Sea scrolls

Go ahead, there's plenty of digital space left on the internet, even for you.
